page.title: 01LANDSCAPE
page.content: The {River Thames}meanders though the area .The flat fertile land of the river valley stretches away to the west,and east of the river the land rises steeply towards{Cliveden and {Taplow},and is wooded .The village of {Cookham }is the main residental area . The old part of the village with its {Norman church },interesting old buildings and the bridge is linked with the more recent development of { {Cookham Rise }with its modern parade of shops and the station by {Cookham {Moor}. Much of the land is agricultural and some is owned by the{National {Trust. Cliveden House} and its grounds is a local beauty spot, and the village has its own art gallery exhibiting the work of {Sir Stanley {Spencer.}
